meanings.definition: To give or apportion (something) to someone as a share or task.
meanings.sent1: She will allot the cookies to each friend at the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will allot time for each student to present their project.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to allot the rabbits equally into his hat, but they kept multiplying!
meanings.sent4: The coach will allot playing time fairly among all team members.
meanings.sent5: The queen will allot jewels to her loyal subjects as a sign of appreciation.

meanings.sent1: The charity will allot food to families in need during the holidays.
meanings.sent2: The supervisor will allot tasks to each employee based on their skills.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels tried to allot the acorns evenly, but the sneaky chipmunk stole some!
meanings.sent4: The rain will allot its drops across the thirsty land.
meanings.sent5: The wind will allot its whispers to the leaves of the trees.
